title: [Placements] Placement Statistics - 2025 batch
content: This is the placement stats of 2025 batch from Placement office. it is official.

comments.body: What's the average and median?
Not even half the ece batch is placed wtf
What was the total batch strength of cse?
probably around 1300 or 1400, so kind of 1/2 student is unplaced
But then how can the median be 12lpa or 14lpa (the figures generally quoted)....do they just take the median of placed students and forget about the rest?
Donno, ask in placement office maybe
Ece and eee core ðŸ¤¡ðŸ¤¡
Iâ€™ve always felt that PES revolves around the CSE branch and the other branches are pretty much just an afterthought

Yes. That is how they calculate metrics in all colleges. It's always the stats of the placed students. 

It's actually a difficult problem if you think about how to account for unplaced students, because using a "0" for them would highly skew the results.
500 cs students also unplaced bro

This sheet shows the placements of RR+ECity combined as they happen together right?

Also, AIML is merged with CS?
Scary stats
Mann but think of it eee is still better our of 60 22 or smtg is placed so 33 percent almost and the other branches are still worst
looks like this is only rr campus with cs + aiml
Ah ok understood

Placement happens together so itâ€™s both rr + ecity combined I think

Does this mean like out of 1243 students only 362 students got fte others didn't??

Please clarify seniors!!
Yes
AIML first batch of placement will happen this year ie class of 2026. So till now there is no stat about aiml.
This is scary
Does this include off-campus placements ?
No

yea this was scary, few days back i went to rr campus to submit my documents and then went to the placement cell to see the placements the guy sitting over there told us that they have put out placement statistics outside But since i was getting admission in ec campus next day i went there and apparently they too had a placement cell where the placement head was a professor who taught 3rd year onwards and he had detailed placement statistics in his room where RR CSE came out to be 17 EC CSE was 14.5 Total CSE Average came out to be 15 and no. Of students placed were much higher so yea idk which one to actually trust since i saw both being claimed true by the placement head
Yeah combined

The number isn't completely accurate because the total also includes students not sitting for placements. Eligible here only refers to those who could have sat for placements. Many choose Masters, off campus, etc.
